content.name: alertConfigSNMPTarget
content.description:
Information about the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) destinations used by alerts.
The system uses SNMP to transfer system alerts as traps to an SNMP destination host. Traps are asynchronous messages that notify the SNMP destination when system and user events occur.

attributes.name: community
attributes.description: Community string used by SNMP v2c, not applicable for SNMP v3.  @engdocs  The community string is specified for SNMP v2c when creating it, it can be changed on the Alert Settings page.

attributes.name: version
attributes.description: SNMP version used to send the traps or informs.    @engdocs  The version is specified when creating each SNMP target, it can't be changed afterwards.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the alertConfigSNMPTarget instance.

attributes.name: privacyProto
attributes.description: Protocol used to enable privacy on the SNMP destination. The privacy protocol  encrypts the SNMP packets.

attributes.name: authProto
attributes.description: Protocol used to authenticate access to the SNMP destination.

attributes.name: username
attributes.description: Username used to access the SNMP destination.  @engdocs  The SNMP username can be set on the Alert Settings page.

attributes.name: address
attributes.description: Host address and port for the SNMP destination. The default UDP port number is  162.
